Is this game worth it?

An absolute and outstanding "yes." I would even go so far as to recommend purchasing the entire half-life bundle all at once to save money, because you're gonna end up buying everything else anyway.

Do it. Give into the hype, because it's truly deserved in this case. Half-Life is a shoot-em-up, but at the same time it's so much more. The game has a compelling storytelling, but unlike other games, offers no cutscenes. The world is dynamic, with little easter eggs hidden everywhere, making the game much more immersive. The characters seem dynamic (although not as dynamic as in the sequel), with many enviormental voice lines tailored to fit lots of situations. The game is paced well, as is the entire series. It never feels repetative, it always finds a way to feel fresh. One of the best things that this game accomplishes that many other games fail at is that the weapon arsenal is large, but each weapon has its own unique purpose. For example, picking up a shiny new SMG won't make your pistol pointless, because the pistol still has better accuracy for picking off smaller enemies from a distance, while the SMG or Shotgun is better for "run-n-gun" tactics.

There is a mystery element to the game, too. It's the mystery of the [spoiler]mysterious man in the suit who is always watching. But who is this man?[/spoiler] That, my friend, will be very important later on............




Oh, and as a side benefit, you'll finally understand all of those "HL3 Confirmed" memes.

The game is also extremely moddable, for example Counter Strike, and Team Fortress were orginally mods for Half-life before becoming their own series.  I would say the game is well worth the money.

Half-Life is a surprisingly great game. I came into it blind, and did not expect survival horror elements. Along with that it is very action based, with some light platforming.

Despite its age, this is still one of the better games I've ever played. It's level design is timeless, and the game doesn't treat you like a baby. The only point I did not enjoy was near the end, but the visuals made up for it.
Classic FPS!  You can't lose playing this game.  I highly recommend the original version over the source port though.

Good old days!!!!

Half-life 2 is a good game, but the first one of the same series is way better, or at least, that's my opinion.

- Good old PC graphics.
- Gameplay is really good.
- Levels are pretty cool.
- Modding is available and it is not too hard to mod the game (creating maps, creating content, etc)

Honestly, I don't have much to say about this game, just get it if you have not already, way better than the second In my opinion, not that the second is bad, this one is just better and its expansions are really great!

I love Half-life's atmosphere. Its creepy, survivalist, victory-against-all-odds feeling. Half-life 2 lacks that, and because of that, the original is better. If anyone ever claims otherwise, their opinion is to be immediately discarded, and any future video game recommendations or impressions that hey might utter are to be ignored.

Half life is truly an amazing game, despite me being unable to finish it due to me not being used to the sensitive keys, rather OP accuracy of the HECU marines and an overall disabled mind, I say I do love Half life, for half life made Black Mesa, Gmod, HL2 and go on and on possible. 9.99-no just kidding }10/10{

For the vast majority of my playtime, this game lives up to its reputation as a classic. The setting is memorable and atmospheric, the story is simple, yet compelling (and is told through gameplay rather than cutscenes), the level design is organic and creative, the weapons feel satifying to use, and the puzzles are challenging enough to feel rewarding, but also intuitive enough to avoid frustration.

That is until you reach the Xen.

The final segment of the game takes everything great about the rest of the game and completely throws it out the window. The levels are confusing and drab, filled with enemies that can suprise kill you in one hit and often blend into the background due to the mushy brown and gray color scheme, with extremely unintuitive and frustrating puzzles that often rely heavily on imprecise platforming and random leaps of faith. 

What should be only a small portion of the game stretches into a tortuously long and frustrating exercise in tedium that crushes your spirit and meticulously destroys every single bit of goodwill that the rest of this excellent game has built up, and for this reason I can't recommend it.
The graphics may be outdated but its is still on of my favorite games to date. :)

Good game

It's one of the corner-stones of PC gaming. Half-Life paved the road for the industry when it was beginning to come into it's stride, and popularized a culture of modders becoming devs, becoming studies. 
As a game, it is still enjoyable and nuanced. A sometimes frightening attention to detail with AI interactions that most players will never come across, and a unique and intriguing story for sci-fi buffs. 
Very recommended to PC gamers of all ages and experience. Grab some mods when you are done, and enjoy the beauty of PC-gaming culture.

Half-Life es un juego que te tomara varias horas de tu vida, estaras tratando de completar la campa√±a o ser el mejor en el multiplayer.

Contando con una gran variedad de armas y niveles (tanto en campa√±a como en multiplayer), Half-Life tiene el prestigio que tienen pocos juegos y es envejecer bien al paso del tiempo. El juego aunque sea de 1998 se mantiene todavia llamativo y entretenido para las nuevas generaciones de videojugadores, no me sorprende que el juego sea considerado de culto y aparte ser uno de los FPS mas importantes en la historia junto con Wolfenstein 3D, Quake, DOOM, etc.

Si tienes ganas de disfrutar un FPS muy bien trabajado y entretenido, este es el juego que estabas buscando.
uj

Ah, Half-Life. This is a revolutionary game, there's no doubt about that. I of course recommend this game to anyone who's played Portal and wants to try the "other half" of the Aperture/Black Mesa rivalry, or just anyone who likes classic first person shooters and wants to experience a bit of PC gaming history.
There's just one major problem I have with Half-Life. I cannot finish it. I can't even bring myself to play it for more than ten minutes.
It's not because it's a bad game or anything. Honestly, I don't know exactly what the reason behind it is. But when I start up Half-Life and play it for a few minutes, a terrible migraine sets in. I get these unbearable headaches while playing these old FPS games. Maybe it's the graphics, or the old sound effects, or something else, but I don't have this problem playing classic 2D games like Super Metroid or Mario Bros, or newer FPS games like Fallout or Portal. It's happened with this game and with a few other classic shooters like DOOM and Duke Nukem 3D. I really don't have an explanation, so if anyone out there has a solution to this problem I would really appreciate being able to bring myself to finish this game without puking.
